title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 July 2009 - XWiki
content:

Denis left at 00:12 ("Leaving.")  
anamarias left at 00:31 ()

sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:19  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 11:19): Hi anamarias  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 11:21  
anamarias - (08/07/2009 11:21): hi sdumitriu   
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 11:23): Sorry, but yesterday I got caught up with some school stuff  
anamarias - (08/07/2009 11:24): no probl, i know very well how it is  
arkub joined #xwiki at 11:36  
guillaum2 joined #xwiki at 11:42  
arkub left at 11:50 ("bye")  
arkub joined #xwiki at 11:50  
anamarias\_ joined #xwiki at 11:55  
guillaum2 left at 11:56 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
anamarias left at 11:57 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 11:58): sdumitriu: sorry, my internet went down for a while  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 11:58): How will the code implementing the classes for the shindig services [0] link to the XWiki components [1] ? in the shindig services [0] I will need to use the DocumentAccessBridge to fetch data about Persons, Activities, AddData and Messages. But for the component I don't really need to expose any methods to other components or velocity. Is that OK ?  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 11:58): Also shindig requires some javascript and css [2]. How will they interact with XWiki ? Maybe JSX and SSX objects ?  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 11:58): [0] - https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/opensocial/xwiki-shindig-samplesmock/src/main/java/org/xwiki/opensocial/social/mock/spi/MockPersonService.java  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 11:58): [1] - https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/opensocial/xwiki-opensocial-component/src/main/java/org/xwiki/opensocial/component/internal/DefaultHelloWorld.java  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 11:58): [2] - https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/opensocial/xwiki-shindig-server/javascript/container/  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:01): (the component implementation [1] extends the person, activities, appdata services, which I realized now that it's silly and really shouldn't)  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:03): The javascript classes and methods make calls directly to shindig jars, which uses the shindig services implementations, so they don't need to go through the component code  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:04): Do these services provide public APIs usable from other Java code?  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:06): i know they get injected with Guice in the shindig code  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:06): i don't know how it works from outside java modules  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:08): but shindig has a OpenSocial REST API  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:08): which uses them  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:08): http://sites.google.com/site/opensocialarticles/Home/shindig-rest-java  
arunreddy joined #xwiki at 12:09  
guillaum2 joined #xwiki at 12:10  
guillaum2 left at 12:30 ("Leaving.")  
rrodriguez left at 12:34 ()  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:43): anamarias\_: How do you declare a component implementation when using guice?  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:44): xwiki component ?  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:44): No  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:44): Shindig component  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:44): I mean, how do you say that XWikiPersonService implements PersonService?  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:45): ah, 1 sec  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:45): here https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/opensocial/xwiki-shindig-samplesmock/src/main/java/org/xwiki/opensocial/social/mock/MockSocialModule.java  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:47): extends SocialApiGuiceModule  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:47): K  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:47): which is used then in the server https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/gsoc/opensocial/xwiki-shindig-server/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/web.full.xml  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:48): which extends com.google.inject.AbstractModule;  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:48): (i mean SocialApiGuiceModule)  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:48): Then you could make it both a Guice component and an XWiki component  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:49): i'm not sure i know what you mean  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:49): The problem is that there's no good reason to make it an XWiki component, since it doesn't provide any APIs to XWiki  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:49): yes  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:49): i only need to use the  DocumentAccessBridge from XWiki  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:50): Yes, but I don't know any way to get hold of it other than making it a component...  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:51): We should have a way of obtaining the component manager from non-components  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:51): But vmassol is on vacation, so he can't help us  
mflorea left at 12:51 ("Leaving")  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:52): i could make it a component in the meantime   
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:52): Yes  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:52): i have 4 distinct classes for the 4 services  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:52): would that mean 4 components ?  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:53): doesn't seem right  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:53): Since this is temporary, you can make 4 implementations for one component  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:53): ah, ok  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:53): So, this means:  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:54): Make a DummyComponent interface  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:54): Add implements DummyComponent to the four classes  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:54): ok  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:55): Add a dependency on org.xwiki.platform xwiki-core-component-default in the pom  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:56): also, the component i have now, i still can't build it. could you help me with that ?  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:56): Annotate the classes with @Component("the classname"), where "the classname" is the name of the class  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:57): Add:  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:57): @Requirement  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:57): private DocumentAccessBridge bridge;  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:57): Create src/main/resources/META-INF/components.txt  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:58): And put the FQNs of the four classes  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:58): That should be all  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:58): can I expose no methods in the component's interface ?  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:58): Yes  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 12:58): OK, let's see what's wrong with the build  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:59): you'll have to build only the xwiki-opensocial-component module  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 12:59): it's not added in the main pom  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:01): I added all the dependencies in the main pom (required by each of the submodules). is that ok ?  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:02): It should be OK  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:02): Is this the error you get?  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:02): Cannot find parent: org.apache.shindig:shindig-parent for project: null:shindig-common:jar:null for project null:shindig-common:jar:null  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:02): hmm no  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:05): it looks like it refers to this dependency in the main pom  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:05):   <dependency>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:05):       <groupId>org.apache.shindig</groupId>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:05):       <artifactId>shindig-common</artifactId>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:05):       <version>1.1-SNAPSHOT-769</version>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:05):     </dependency>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:09): now i have a different problem than befere  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:09): [INFO] Compilation failure  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:09): found   : java.lang.Object  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:09): required: java.lang.String  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:09): found   : java.lang.Object  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:09): required: java.lang.String  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:09): which is weird, because the parameters are Strings  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:10): this line String firstName =  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:10):                 documentAccessBridge.getProperty(userDocumentName, userClassName, userFirstNamePropertyName);  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:11): No, it was changed a few days ago  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:11): You can cast it  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:12): ah  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:15): ok, now I get the real error, which is http://ana-s-private-labs.pastebin.com/m7b5bdb7c  
florinciu\_ joined #xwiki at 13:15  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:18): xwiki-core-component, is the only one with the version 1.9  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:18): <groupId>org.xwiki.platform</groupId>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:18):       <artifactId>xwiki-core-component</artifactId>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:18):       <version>1.9-SNAPSHOT</version>  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:18): all other are 2.0  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:19): because if I try to use 2.0 it says it's missing   
florinciu left at 13:28 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out))  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 13:49  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:49): anamarias\_: Why are there so many dependencies? caja, ezmorph, nekohtml, wstx, sanselan, findbugs, geronimo, juel...  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:54): they are needed by the shindig modules  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:54): maybe it's because i put as the parent pom of these modules my module, and not shindig's  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:55): for xwiki-shindig-samplesmock, the parent is org.xwiki.platform xwiki-opensocial-parent  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:56): Where can I get these dependencies from?  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:56): I have 9 missing deps  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:56): and not let's say org.apache.shindig shindig-parent  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 13:57): hmm shouldn't maven get them ?  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 13:59): Yes, but they are not found  
tmortagne left at 14:00 ("Ex-Chat")  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 14:00): hmm... for me it works... what can I do to see what's wrong ?  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 14:01): these are some of the original pom files  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 14:01): http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/incubator/shindig/trunk/java/samples/pom.xml?view=co&content-type=text%2Fplain  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 14:01): http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/incubator/shindig/trunk/java/social-api/pom.xml?view=co&content-type=text%2Fplain  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 14:02): no, this is the good one http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/shindig/trunk/  
anamarias\_ - (08/07/2009 14:05): i got some of the server dependencies here http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/shindig/trunk/java/server/pom.xml and from the samples http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/shindig/trunk/java/samples/pom.xml (shindig services implementations module)

maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:12): hi tmortagne can i leave two proposals here for the xwiki.org site and it's information?  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:15): maggolo: I think it's better to discuss this kind of thing on the mailing list for everyone to have a chance to look at it  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:16): unless it's very small  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:16): i think it's small but i can write it this way http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Survey  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:17): ha i did not even remembered we had this :)  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:17): looks like the right way yes  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:17): ok ;-)  
kaaloo1 left at 16:21 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer))  
kaaloo joined #xwiki at 16:21  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:22): tmortagne one very small thing on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotes#HXWikiEnterpriseManager you wirte not yet released but its downloadable i found this because every time when i will update my  xem i'm searching around the common migration notes of the last XE release because i want to know if the databases has changed.  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:23): and this is my proposal if you can put a link on the instruction page to this release or common migration note or as a link in the menu, i think this is an information that everyone need every time he is updating his XE or others  
b00b joined #xwiki at 16:25  
b00b - (08/07/2009 16:26): hi  
sdumitriu - (08/07/2009 16:28): Hi b00b  
b00b - (08/07/2009 16:29): does anyone know a bit about the Lucene plugin ? i'd like to know if there's a way to make a search (getSearchResults) by classname ?  
b00b - (08/07/2009 16:30): for example, i'd like to get only results that are XWikiClasses objects  
b00b - (08/07/2009 16:30): i manage to search by type (type:objects) but not by classname  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:30): maggolo: there is always a link to the XE migration note in XEM release note migration note  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:31): or i don't understand what you want  
b00b - (08/07/2009 16:31): and i'd like to do it within the query (not by parsing the result after that)  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:31): fixing the "not release yet", thanks for the report  
jvdrean - (08/07/2009 16:32): tmortagne: sorry about that  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:33): tmortagne yes the link is there and thats good ... but you don't can get via link to the releas notes quickly, my way to find this page is every time to search after "common migration notes" and than i have to go thru the search results. hope i had explained it now so you do understand what i mean  
anamarias left at 16:34 ()  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:36): maggolo: i'm not sure, can you do it directly to show me what you mean  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:37): tmortagne ok wait i have to find the needed pages   
jvdrean - (08/07/2009 16:39): b00b: "object:XWiki.XWikiUsers"  
jvdrean - (08/07/2009 16:39): "object:XWiki.XWikiUsers OR object:XWiki.XWikiGroups"  
jvdrean - (08/07/2009 16:39): b00b: something like this ?  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:41): tmortagne: ok now, i have to search "release notes" (http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/LuceneSearch?text=release+notes&space=&wikinames=) to find the link to this site http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotes  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:45): tmortagne today i know what i have to search to find the right site, but in in 8 weeks ?? so i think release and migration notes are important information for everyone and should easily found by everyone i think a good place is the "general link" list or this site http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation because this link can i find if i go on the download page and behind every download page you have the instruction links   
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:47): or is there a way or a point of under that i didn't find till now?  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:48): i don't think it's needed in http://manager.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation since anyway you have to go to download page to get XEM  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:48): what do you mean by "general links" list ?  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:49): i see  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:49): sorry i was looking at manager  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:49): yes adding release notes in general links is a good idea  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:50): even i guess most of the time you look at the release note when you want to download a new version  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:50): and you have the link in download page  
tmortagne - (08/07/2009 16:52): done, added just before Roadmap link, sounds logical that way  
rrodriguez left at 16:53 ()  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 16:54): tmortagne fine, i think that helps other too.   
b00b - (08/07/2009 16:56): jvdrean: thanks it works fine !

maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:35): hi@ all  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:35): do someone know about the grooy console applikation  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:36): hi maggolo   
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:36): I made that application :)  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:36): cool,  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:37): can you tell me why the groovy console does nothing if i press execute?  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:38): have you saved the GroovyConsoleExecutor page with a user that has programming rights?  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:39): XWiki.GroovyConsoleExecutor, if I recall correctly  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:39): hm i imported it with superadmin in an virtual wiki but if i go to this grovvyconsoleexecuter i got only the code  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:39): also, what version of XWiki are u on?  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:39): wait i'll save it again  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:39): I'm not sure superadmin has programming rights actually  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:40): but anyway import with a user that has prog. right is not enough  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:40): yes because the groovy code works on other pages  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:40): try saving it with somebody you are sure has prog. right  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:40): there is a {pre} tag of the beginng ist this correct or should i delete this  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:40): like admin from the master wiki  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:41): should be correct  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:41): it's supposed to work out of the box (except that programming right issue)  
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:41): ok now there no code anymore, output is This is a groovy executor   
maggolo - (08/07/2009 20:42): is that ok?  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:42): ok looks better  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:42): you can try again the console  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:42): we are aware this "you have to save with prog right" thing is not very conveniant  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:43): an alternative we have before we revamp the right and application packaging model is to have the application warn you itself  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:43): since code can test if the pages are saved with prog right or not

jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:46): yes, I meant that your application can check itself if everything is fine to run, with APIs like #if($xwiki.getDocument("XWiki.GroovyExecutorConsole").hasProgrammingRights()) #warning("you have a problem there") #else run the appli #end  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:46): I have to take the habit of doing that :)  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:46): so that the install is less painful  
jvelociter - (08/07/2009 20:47): does it work now the console?
